stream_context.summary: Kaze works on Course 12 (Wild-West world) assets and missions while testing a brand-new collision/step system. Tasks include a poster bulletin board, a minecart chase mission, an NPC bank clerk Koopa, and the entrance to a Monty-Mole boss arena. He also demonstrates an auto-sizing text-box feature and discusses level pacing and course order.

development_findings.summary: Kaze rewrote Mario’s entire collision and step system yesterday; it now binary-searches for the largest valid step, uses raycasts for speed, verifies floors/ceilings, is faster than Nintendo’s and independent of SM64 code, but ceiling bonks and some rollout-to-kick edge cases remain.
development_findings.quote: Once my new collision system is done, this game will be so nice collision-wise, I think, much better than any other Mario 64 thing.

development_findings.summary: New spin-jump move uses Mario’s Down-B from Smash Melee as reference; Zeina animated it and Kaze polished.
development_findings.quote: The closest you have to an official version of the spin jump from 1996 is Mario's Down-B from Smash Melee, so I went with that one.

development_findings.summary: Bulletin-board object assembled: Zeina’s hand-drawn ‘Wanted’ posters converted to fog-shaded decals; Kaze fixed Fast64 defaulting to ENV shading, set opaque/Layer 4, and aligned UVs to avoid coordinate quantisation.
development_findings.quote: If you default something to environment, it actually will render wrong… I was suffering in the ship level.

development_findings.summary: Minecart chase mission finished conceptually: player discovers secret saloon door, chases Shy-Guys on tracks, difficulty scales, falling on tracks kills; current crash is due to unfinished collision code (area 6 null).
development_findings.quote: Imagine this but without the crash—the crash is because of my new collision functions.

development_findings.summary: Designing Monty-Mole bank-heist star: bank NPC explains robbery, player follows particle trail/tunnel to boss fight. Entrance will be a breakable boulder requiring the Bob-omb cap; cardboard/cloth ideas were dropped as too obvious or complex.
development_findings.quote: I think a breakable boulder would solve this… use the bomb cap and a breakable thing here.

development_findings.summary: Auto-sizing text-box system added; text window now shrinks/grows to fit content, easing localisation.
development_findings.quote: It will automatically find the right size to encapsulate the text. Biobak, you’re gonna like this a lot if you want to translate this game.

development_findings.summary: 100-coin stars removed; replaced by collectible Yoshi coins that award the star, simplifying flow.
development_findings.quote: There are no 100 coins in this.

development_findings.summary: Course order under review: Wild-West world may move from Course 12 to Course 13; castle fever-dream and Rainbow Reef ordering still open.
development_findings.quote: Reconsider course order—move Wild West to Course 13.

development_findings.summary: Koopa Bank-Clerk NPC modeled: old man with beard, small glasses, cane (Zeina to make), black shell/shoes; vertex-color vs shading constraints discussed (N64 can’t do both on 1-cycle).
development_findings.quote: Being bald in a video game is not about whether you have hair, it's about the vibe.

development_findings.summary: Engine idle thread runs at ~75 %—Kaze joked about inserting a Bitcoin miner to use spare CPU cycles.
development_findings.quote: What if the idle thread was just mining Bitcoins? It'd be very funny.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values SM64’s movement but dislikes its ‘placeless’ level design; wants each course to have a strong theme or vibe.
context_findings.quote: A lot of them just exist and they don't really feel like anything.

context_findings.summary: He moved to North America ‘to run away from taxes’; works in a cold basement where a noisy water-heater disrupts streams.
context_findings.quote: All I want to be is in my basement in silence, making Mario.

context_findings.summary: Generally upbeat; says nearly all his days are good; currently dieting to drop to 205 lbs from 213.
context_findings.quote: I'm barely eating compared to before.

context_findings.summary: Refuses to pay for Project64 due to past malware bundling; considered buying WinRAR as exception.
context_findings.quote: Why would I pay for free software?

context_findings.summary: Mentions financial/time cost: game expected to last 10–12 hours for players; recognizes scope vs schedule (fifty courses hyperbole).
context_findings.quote: It still took him 50 minutes for one course… this game has like a 10 to 12 hour runtime.

biobak.summary: Provides many graphics/assets and is likely to handle translations; welcomed the new auto-resize text feature.

badub.summary: Composes soundtrack; fans ask about music release; Kaze defers to Badub’s schedule.

zeina.summary: Animated the new spin-jump; created bulletin-board textures; making cane for bank Koopa; sometimes forgets to bundle textures, causing in-stream fixes.
zeina.quote: Zeina made the animation and I just polished it up a little bit.

zeina.summary: Personal dynamic: lives upstairs; noises heard during stream; casual banter about her dad plowing driveway and height jokes.

key_stories.title: Total Collision Rewrite
key_stories.summary: On a whim, Kaze scrapped Mario 64’s 1996 collision and built a new, faster raycast-binary-search hybrid that avoids most clipping issues.
key_stories.challenge: Original SM64 collision allowed multiple clip exploits and raycast replacement had new bugs.
key_stories.process: Started fresh yesterday, wrote binary-search step, added move verifications, integrated into engine, tested live.
key_stories.outcome: Movement already feels better; ceiling and rollout bugs remain, but Kaze confident it will surpass any prior hack.
key_stories.key_quote: Once my new collision system is done, this game will be so nice collision-wise… much better than any other Mario 64 thing.

key_stories.title: Minecart Mini-Game Crash
key_stories.summary: Kaze showcased the completed Shy-Guy minecart chase but the game crashed mid-demo due to unfinished collision area linking.
key_stories.challenge: Integrating new step function caused area 6 to be missing, triggering a crash.
key_stories.process: Demonstrated chase, identified crash source, noted need to finish collision and area loading.
key_stories.outcome: Mission design approved; stability fix queued.
key_stories.key_quote: Imagine this but without the crash—the crash is because of my new collision functions.

key_stories.title: Designing the Bank Heist Entrance
key_stories.summary: Kaze brainstormed how players discover the Monty-Mole tunnel: cardboard cut-out, cloth, or breakable rock.
key_stories.challenge: Need an entrance that isn’t accidentally obvious yet rewards attentive players.
key_stories.process: Discussed cloth physics (too complex), fake cardboard (too obvious), settled on bomb-breakable boulder with particle trail.
key_stories.outcome: Decision: place a Bob-omb-cap-breakable boulder, particle hints, bank NPC dialogue.
key_stories.key_quote: I think a breakable boulder would solve this… use the bomb cap and a breakable thing here.
